MatchedRegions.transcript: So first, let's talk about our motivation.

MatchedRegion.Text: Motivation
Misinformation campaigns are manipulating public opinions on hot-spot topics, e.g. COVID-19 epidemic and vaccines [1,2].
To design mitigation strategies to reduce user susceptibility to misinformation, we need to understand how misinformation influence user beliefs and activities.
However, most of the existing works suffers from one or more of following limitations:
Focus on correlation between misinformation and user activities [1,2]. Cannot distinguish causal effect of misinformation from user prior belief
Rely on random controlled experiments and surveys [3,4]
High cost & Ethical risk
USC Viterbi School of
